fields.headline: Numbersix grabs No 1 spot
fields.bodyText: Numbersix valverde got up in the dying strides under a brilliant Ruby Walsh ride to take the Powers Gold Label Irish Grand National at Fairyhouse yesterday, writes Tony Paley. Jack High, trained by Walsh's father Ted, was caught close home after appearing to have taken a decisive advantage at the second-last. Winning trainer Martin Brassil said: "He is only really a novice, but he is a sound jumper and always gets himself out of trouble when he has to. The horse has done more than we expected, so he deserves a break and could come back next year, although faster ground would not suit." Jack High and third-placed Marcus Du Berlais were both cut in the betting for the John Smith's Grand National on Saturday week, with William Hill trimming the former to 25-1, while the latter is now a 33-1 shot
